availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer. Son of John Netherton and Margaret Netherton. Married to Martha L. Yager Netherton in Oldham County, Kentucky, on September 26, 1851. Father of Alice M. Netherton, Anna B. Netherton, Maggie Netherton, and John Netherton. Farmer in Oldham County in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Farmer in Oldham County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860. Farmer in Oldham County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 149B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 897.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 171A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Brownsboro, p. 22B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Oldham County, KY, July 1863, p. 366.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Oldham County Marriages, Film 000482442.
"James N. Netherton (1830-1894)," Find A Grave, Memorial 64652150, accessed March 11, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64652150.
